page.title: 04Milborne Port Parish Council
page.content: Following the 1894 Local Government Act,a{Parish Council}was established for Milborne Port.This replaced the "vestry",a meeting in theory of all the male inhabitants,but in practice of the more prominent.The"vestry" still meets once a year,to elect church wardens. The{Town hall,}previously the property of the Medlycott family,was purchased by the parish in 1949. Milborne Port had its own fire engine, presented by T.Medlycott in 1733 which was in use for over 100 years.In 1951 it was sent on permanent loan to the County Museum in Taunton. Today the council still meets on the third Tuesday of every month at the Town Hall.The{Parish Council}is elected every four years when 13 members are elected to serve.
